articles.content: At first glance, HBO Maxs Made For Love looks like a Black Mirror episode in the disguise of a half-hour comedy series. In short, its the story of Hazel Green (Cristin Milioti) who runs away from her… [+1261 chars]

articles.description: Ricky Staub's Concrete Cowboy zeroes in on North Philadelphia’s Black cowboy enclave, a place where horse stables contrast with a rapidly gentrifying urban area.

articles.title: Priyanka Chopra says she finds filming during the Covid pandemic 'worrisome' - Daily Mail
articles.description: The actress, 38, spoke to Tania Bryer in a special CNBC Conversation where she discussed the Covid crisis and insisted she takes precautions on set 'very seriously'.
articles.content:
Priyanka Chopra has said that she finds filming during the pandemic 'worrisome' due to her asthma and husband Nick Jonas' type 1 diabetes, which makes him high-risk.

articles.title: Despite History-Making Noms, 'Judas and the Black Messiah's' All-Black Producing Team Find Oscar Success to Be - Hollywood Reporter
articles.description: Charles King, Shaka King and Ryan Coogler acknowledge the importance of their Academy Award nominations but still wrestle with the meaning of an honor that has excluded so many: "Why did it take 93 years?"
articles.content:
The first time Ryan Coogler, Charles King and Shaka King collaborated, no one was planning to make movie history. Instead, they were trying to face a crisis.
